FdoIActivateTopologyArea Class Reference

#include <IActivateTopologyArea.h>

Inherits FdoICommand.

Inheritance diagram for FdoIActivateTopologyArea:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Using this command, the client application can control which topology data is in an area of interest. This is an optional performance hint whose effects will vary by provider.

Note:
This Help topic is provided for informational use only. There is no interface or support provided. Autodesk reserves the right to change the software related to the content herein.

Definition at line 32 of file IActivateTopologyArea.h.


Public Member Functions

virtual FDO_API void Execute ()=0
 Executes the command.
virtual FDO_API GisByteArray * GetArea ()=0
 Gets the area in which to work. This is the accessor for the value that the caller sets via SetArea.
virtual FDO_API GisString * GetName ()=0
 Gets the name of the topology to activate. This is the accessor for the value that the caller sets via SetName.
virtual FDO_API void SetArea (GisByteArray *area)=0
 Sets the area in which to work. This allows the caller to tell FDO where feature edits are expected to happen. The only supported area is an extent, given as a rectangular geometry. To acquire such a geometry, use: GisGeometryFactoryAbstract::CreateGeometry(GisIEnvelope *);.
virtual FDO_API void SetName (GisString *name)=0
 Sets the name of the topology to activate.
